newsitem.title: USA: Union Pacific Resources expands facility.
newsitem.headline: Union Pacific Resources expands facility.

text.p: Union Pacific Resources Group Inc's Union Pacific Fuels Inc said it and Koch Hydrocarbon Co would double the production capacity at their jointly owned Mont Belvieu, Texas, natural gas liquids fractionation facility.
The Mont Belvieu I facility's fractionation capacity is currently 105,000 barrels of natural gas liquids per day, and the expansion will increase the plant's capacity to 200,000 barrels per day.
The Mont Belvieu plant is operated by Koch Hydrocarbon Co., which owns 80 percent of the facility. Union Pacific Fuels Inc has the remaining 20 percent ownership interest.
"This capacity increase provides expanded capabilities along the Gulf Coast to satisfy our customers' growing needs," said Shelby Odell, president, Koch Hydrocarbon Co.
The project is expected to be completed in August 1998, and will involve enlarging the plant by just one additional fractionation column, Union Pacific.
